channel.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
channel.description:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/news/7923/]Weeeeeeee.[/url]
Can't wait to get started with this!

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: deadlife101
item.description:
Well even though I have Portal 2 on Xbox 360, I just bought it on steam today because of this new dlc. And I must say, it’s very addictinng.

Read full topic

item.source: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: Dalrus
item.description:
I’m having a really great time messing around with this. Two of the maps I’ve made have been published, and I’m already working on more.

The shorter of the two, focusing on lazors and fizzlers.

A longer, more difficult map.

I had some ideas for faith plates, but found that you can’t connect them to anything. With any luck Valve will expand the pallet of test elements.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: jishdefish
item.description:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=68519164

My first map, Blueberry Gelatin. Turrets, Repulsion Gel, and one lonely Companion Cube.

The second one (Beta Carotene) is going to be longer and is nearly finished. My third is in the thinking stages. So far each of my chambers uses a single gel type.

Read full topic

item.source: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: lunertexcosmo
item.description:
deadlife101:

I really wish that this was released on Xbox 360, that’s what I have Portal 2 on.

Lucky for you, out of the goodness of their heart, Valve made this weekend Steam Workshop Madness. You can buy Portal 2 at 66% ($6.79) plus Skyrim at 33% off ($40.19).

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: Magnitus
item.description:
well if you look in the steamapps/common/portal2/dlc_2/materials/puzzlemaker/palette

you will notice crusher icon and door icons is there and some other stuff this may tell us it will come later

but i want this to be added

  • ability to disable the blue lines
  • ability to create co-op maps
  • more stuff to use

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
Nothing says they can’t fix it and add more stuff, this is only the beginning! Also, you’ll notice (and this may be wishful thinking) that the inventory on the left of the screen has a tab called ‘items’… but it looks like they left space for other tabs to go there, as well. Otherwise, why have the single, lonely tab be there at all?

Oh and also, the ability to use different tilesets would be awesome. I love the look and style of the old 50’s testing chambers, or rather testing spheres. So much cooler than the new test chambers.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Ibanez:

I kind of wish they could include more items to use… for example, the ability to place a portal gun and use pre-placed portals that are activated by buttons.

I was extremely upset over the blatant lack of spike walls. Or the ability to make something like a wall of lasers flash on and off to force the player to time it carefully.

Read full topic

item.source: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
brokenfridgehinge:

Thanks! Just have a go with it, I didn’t really know what I was doing. It’s very easy to use the editor, but quite challenging to create a well designed map.

I think yours was great, I would just add a couple seconds on to the light bridge timer. Also, in that drop/portal room, you could add a small button puzzle or something that operates an angled board or moving platform for people like me who are awful at reaction speed aiming.

@Garcian: I’m going to play yours again when I get around to playing these new ones posted, I think I accidentally skipped most of it.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: vanSulli
item.description:
Hammer works, now. If you want to share your work but don’t like the new ‘editor,’ you can upload single-player maps that you made in Hammer to the Workshop using bin/p2map_publish.exe in your portal 2 folder.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: The_Laughing_Man
item.description:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=68600068

this is my first, medium difficult i think…

Rosie nice map but the last cube, the one you have to catch with the “Unstationary Scaffold” is completly useless, you should make non-portable the wall near the last platform the bring you to exit, or make in connectet with the button… i portaled over the platform and it moved up toward the exit without the cube in place

item.title: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
I’m trying to upload my two small test chambers and download your guys’ maps too, but there is a network error atm.

I am sad panda.

EDIT:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=68689053

Here is my first one, it should be pretty simple. I’ll try and get the second up and running, but first I’m trying the other ones posted.

EDIT: EDIT:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=68692191

Here is the second, should be a little harder than the first, but nothing special I think. Should be bug/exploit free.

So far I’ve played Garcian and Fridge’s tests. Pretty fun! Fridge, that speed test is murder though.

EDIT:EDIT:EDIT: Just played Rosie’s. Really nice map, I like the extra details.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 Perpetual Testing Initiative DLC Live!
